What can I say that has not already been said.  One of the best computer games of all time, ever.  The sequel takes the original 3D puzzle mechanics of the original, and expands them, adds fantastic environments and atmosphere, suburb writing, and first class voice actors.  One of my top 5 favorite games ever in over 3 decades of gaming.  

My Mom liked it.  My niece liked it.  My friend who claims to hate video games liked it.  The teenage guy in my physics study group can't stop quoting lines from it years after it came out.  This is a great game for people who want to exercise their spatial reasoning skills.  It is also a forgiving game for a newbie who has never used WASD and mouse, or played FPS games.

If you have any interest in this game, buy it.  Also, it's often on sale.  

When you've re-played it so many times it's boring, there are endless fan-made levels you can download, some of which are nearly as good as the real thing.

Portal 2 is perhaps the best example of everything a sequel to a good game should be. It builds on the mechanics of the first game while retaining the same tone and style, it introduces new characters and new lore without becoming cluttered, and it remains just as fun. It keeps to the same difficulty, just enough to make you feel triumphant when you progress without getting frustrated when you take a while. Above all, though, it gives us all a bit more of what we've come to crave without overstaying its welcome.

An amazing sequial to Portal, Portal 2 explores more of the universe of Portal and provides more unique mechanics to play around in. A great single player experience, stock full of good puzzles and story telling as well as an equally great multiplayer campaign. All of this along with workshop support for multiplayer levels make Portal 2 a must buy.

Portal 2 is...
It's a good story, not unbelievable awesome, but also not boring. You kinda wanna know how everything works out, but the original Portal game is in my opinion at least at this point better. Grafic ist good. A lot of fun and challenging but not too hard puzzles are there as well, I mean it's Portal... So although I really think its a very good game, and I'm really recommending spending the 5$ or something on it (when there's a sale), although that, I got a little bored some times, when I had to search in a huuuuge hall for a place to shoot a portal at for example, so moments like that where a lil frustrating.

Portal 2 Ã© um jogo que eu adorei muito, com Ã³ptimos grÃ¡ficos, quebra-cabeÃ§as, e Ã© claro a grande aventura, mas nÃ£o consegui encontrar o maldito bolo. E espero que haja o Portal 3 :D
Worth the money, great game

TL/DR = A great game all around, worth every penny.

Pros:
-Runs smoothly on low end hardware with occasional frame drops. Tested this with a mini tower from a few years ago with an Intel Pentium and integrated graphics and the game was playable. Mid-range computers will handle this game with no issues at all.
-Excellent story. The gameplay mixes nicely with the story and makes sense. Not rushed at all.
-Interesting and diverse characters despite there only being two major characters besides yourself.
-Dry humor that isn't forced; the humor is integrated cleanly into the story.
-Great replay value. Even if you somehow get sick of the main story, there's co-op and content from the Steam Workshop. Plenty of achievements too if you're interested in those.
-Create your own test chambers.
-The puzzles are unique and diverse. I never felt like I was replaying a previous puzzle.
-Tons of easter eggs
-Clean and simple UI

Neutral:
-This game will make you feel smart sometimes and stupid sometimes.
-Some levels may induce extreme frustration, especially if it's your first puzzle game.
-Graphics are acceptable, but still hold up well from a game released in 2011.
-Some of the soundtrack is great, some of it can be annoying

Cons:
None

This game has been out for almost 7 years but is still worth playing. Hoping that there'll be a new addition to the Portal series eventually.
Game making at its best. Dont forget to do coop with a friend.

Amazingly good. Played through with my 6 year old son. We LOVED Portal 1. The sequel didn't disappoint. It was harder, darker, more varied and equally satisfying.

And the first 5 minutes? Pure brilliance. The additional character was so fun. Perfect voice-actor choice, too.

We haven't even touched the content outside the solo campaign yet, but I felt compelled to give thanks immediately.
